question: The collective of investors is risk averse. This is why all risks will be compensated with a risk premium.
Beta is the relation between the unsystematic risk of a single asset and the risk of the market portfolio.
Beta measures the relative systematic risk between an asset and the market.
A risk premium is the difference between a security's return and the risk-free return.
The standard statistical measures of the variability of stock returns are beta and covariance.
Diversification reduces the risk of a portfolio when prices of different securities do not move exactly together.
The portfolio risk that cannot be eliminated by diversification is called specific or idiosyncratic risk.
The average beta of all stocks in the market is zero.
The beta of an equally-weighted portfolio including all assets is equal to 1.
A portfolio with a beta of one offers an expected return equal to the market risk premium.
